TraitInfos.Name: ClassicParallelProductionQueue
TraitInfos.Description: Attach this to the player actor (not a building!) to define a new shared build queue. Will only work together with the Production: trait on the actor that actually does the production. You will also want to add PrimaryBuildings: to let the user choose where new units should exit. The production speed depends on the number of production buildings and units queued at the same time.

Properties.Description: If you build more actors of the same type, the same queue will get its build time lowered for every actor produced there.
Every time another production building of the same queue is constructed, the build times of all actors in the queue modified by a percentage of the original time.
Build time modifier multiplied by the number of parallel production for producing different actors at the same time.
What kind of production will be added (e.g. Building, Infantry, Vehicle, ...)
The value used when ordering this for display (e.g. in the Spectator UI).
Group queues from separate buildings together into the same tab.
Only enable this queue for certain factions.
Should the prerequisite remain enabled if the owner changes?
Should right clicking on the icon instantly cancel the production instead of putting it on hold?
This percentage value is multiplied with actor cost to translate into build time (lower means faster).
Maximum number of a single actor type that can be queued (0 = infinite).
Maximum number of items that can be queued across all actor types (0 = infinite).
The build time is multiplied with this percentage on low power.
Production items that have more than this many items in the queue will be produced in a loop.
Notification played when production is complete. The filename of the audio is defined per faction in notifications.yaml.
Notification displayed when production is complete.
Notification played when you can't train another actor when the build limit exceeded or the exit is jammed. The filename of the audio is defined per faction in notifications.yaml.
Notification displayed when you can't train another actor when the build limit exceeded or the exit is jammed.
Notification played when you can't queue another actor when the queue length limit is exceeded. The filename of the audio is defined per faction in notifications.yaml.
Notification displayed when you can't queue another actor when the queue length limit is exceeded.
Notification played when you can't place a building. Overrides PlaceBuilding.CannotPlaceNotification for this queue. The filename of the audio is defined per faction in notifications.yaml.
Notification played when user clicks on the build palette icon. The filename of the audio is defined per faction in notifications.yaml.
Notification displayed when user clicks on the build palette icon.

TraitInfos.Name: AmbientSound
TraitInfos.Description: Plays a looping audio file at the actor position. Attach this to the `World` actor to cover the whole map.
